unnormalised: **Vendor Audits Under Scrutiny as Manufacturers Seek Supply Chain Resilience**
normalised: vendor audits under scrutiny as manufacturers seek supply chain resilience

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – Manufacturing companies across India are increasingly focusing on stringent vendor audits in the wake of recent supply chain disruptions. Companies are implementing more frequent and detailed assessments to ensure compliance with quality standards and ethical sourcing practices.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – Manufacturing companies across India are increasingly focusing on stringent vendor audits in the wake of recent supply chain disruptions. Companies are implementing more frequent and detailed assessments to ensure compliance with quality standards and ethical sourcing practices.

unnormalised: "We've ramped up our audit frequency by 30% in the past quarter," said Ms. Priya Sharma, Head of Procurement at Tata Steel. "This includes both on-site inspections and remote documentation reviews, particularly in areas critical for our raw material needs.”
normalised: “We've ramped up our audit frequency by thirty percent in the past quarter,” said Ms. Priya Sharma, Head of Procurement at Tata Steel. “This includes both on site inspections and remote documentation reviews, particularly in areas critical for our raw material needs.”

unnormalised: Several companies are now mandating adherence to ISO 9001:2015 certifications and implementing robust corrective action plans. The audits often cover labour practices, environmental compliance, and cybersecurity protocols.
normalised: Several companies are now mandating adherence to I S O nine thousand one two thousand fifteen certifications and implementing robust corrective action plans. The audits often cover labor practices, environmental compliance, and cybersecurity protocols.

unnormalised: Ahead of the Diwali rush, pressure is mounting on suppliers to maintain consistent quality. One Chennai-based garment manufacturer highlighted the importance of these audits to ensure the final product meets export standards and the demand for festive apparel can be met. The process often involves sharing a meal of biryani and discussing the festive season.

unnormalised: The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi is partnering with several companies to develop advanced audit methodologies using AI. These methodologies aim to identify potential risks earlier in the supply chain, improving overall resilience. The initial findings suggest that these methods could save companies upwards of Rs. 50 Lakh annually.
